info.title: About Landolt C Test
info.subtitle: A scientific method for measuring visual acuity
info.what_is_title: What is the Landolt C Test?
info.what_is_content: The Landolt C test is a standardized method for measuring visual acuity. It uses rings with gaps in different directions (up, down, left, right) to determine how well you can see at various distances.
info.how_works_content: The test presents rings with gaps in random directions. You identify the gap direction, and the system adjusts the ring size based on your responses. Smaller rings indicate better visual acuity.
info.test_types_content: Two testing methods are available: Swipe Test (touch gestures) and Voice Test (speech recognition). Both methods provide accurate results and can be used based on your preference.
info.results_content: Results are displayed in multiple formats: Score (number of correct answers), LogMAR (logarithmic scale), and Snellen notation (traditional 20/20 format). Lower LogMAR values indicate better vision.
info.accuracy_content: The Landolt C test is clinically validated and provides reliable visual acuity measurements. However, it's designed for screening purposes and should not replace professional eye examinations.
info.step_1: Select your preferred test type (swipe or voice)
info.step_3: Test each eye separately by covering the other
info.step_4: Identify the gap direction in the Landolt C rings
info.disclaimer_content: This test is for screening purposes only and is not a substitute for professional eye examination. Always consult with an eye care professional for comprehensive vision assessment.

eye_tiredness.title: Eye Tiredness Test
eye_tiredness.instructions: Hold your device and match your face within the circle and sit in a well-lit room.
